job_description:
Finanzen
München
Im Überblick
Junior
Vollzeit
Festanstellung
Über diesen Job
CHECK24 is one of Germany’s leading online companies and its largest comparison portal. And we keep growing—with you!

Loans are highly personalized, and we handle a large volume of customer applications with our financial partners to deliver tailored solutions. This challenges traditional APIs and architecture, driving us to create smart, innovative solutions. As a QA Engineer, you’ll design and validate tests using tools like Playwright or Selenium, extend APIs, and verify data with MySQL or Elasticsearch queries.

We look forward to your application for the role of (Junior) Quality Assurance Engineer (m/f/d) - Loans at CHECK24 Vergleichsportal Finanzen GmbH in Munich.

We look forward to receiving your application for the position of (Junior) Quality Assurance Engineer (m/f/d) - Loans at CHECK24 Vergleichsportal Finanzen GmbH in Munich.
Your Qualifications
Educational Background: Completed training as an IT specialist, a comparable IT qualification, or a degree in computer science
Testing Tools Expertise: Experience with manual testing tools like Postman, Insomnia, or cURL
Programming Knowledge: Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, Python, C#, NodeJS, JavaScript, or TypeScript
Testing Experience: Initial experience in testing web applications or software, including familiarity with testing methods, tools, and test automation (e.g., Playwright, Selenium)
Database Skills: Solid knowledge of SQL and databases, along with experience using ticketing systems like JIRA or Trello
Attention to Quality: Strong sense of quality and customer-oriented thinking
Language Proficiency: Fluent in English and German (minimum B2 level)
Your Responsibilities

Testing & Quality Assurance:
Regularly test web applications and software across devices to ensure functionality
Conduct manual (60%) and automated (40%) testing of new software versions to meet product requirements

Process Optimization:
Enhance and automate testing processes and infrastructure within the team

Collaboration & Support:
Develop and update test plans with product management
Analyze test results and provide input for new feature implementation
Your Benefits
With hundreds of developers, in small agile teams, we are more than a website
Modern working: Flexible working hours model with a fair mobile working arrangement
Experience and stability: More than 15 years of successes and failures shared across the group in over 15 locations
Working with customer orientation: Each division at CHECK24 acts largely independently and unconditionally oriented towards its customers. This means focus and working methods like in a start-up with small teams and without superfluous coordination
Environment that demands and promotes openness and willingness to learn: You take responsibility in your team right from the start. If your ideas make our products better, we will adopt them. You know a tool that makes us better as a team? We will implement it together with you
We'll help you get ahead: Together with you, your manager is responsible for your personal development in your daily work. For this purpose, we offer trainings especially designed for our employees, such as the deepening of your IT skills
We value your commitment: Permanent contracts and attractive compensation with annual bonuses for special successes. Vouchers for numerous CHECK24 products, a subsidized company pension plan up to special conditions in fitness studios and a subsidized MVV ticket
Food & Drinks: In addition to one free meal per day (breakfast or lunch), we provide you with fresh fruit from the region and you are also free to help yourself to drinks
Checkito-Spirit: We know that only excellent teams develop excellent online products. That's why events to celebrate and network as well as our legendary summer and Christmas parties are part of our daily work routine
Kontakt
Valentina Heidenreich
valentina.heidenreich@check24.de
Bitte sende uns Bewerbungen ausschließlich online über unser Bewerbungsformular.
zu allen Blogartikeln

job_description:
ABOUT THIS ROLE

Our mission at Avelios is to build the leading software platform for the data-driven digitization of hospitals and patient care. To do so, we have built a modular software platform that digitizes and optimizes workflows in hospitals with cutting-edge technology in a user-friendly way. With our software, we enable hospitals, doctors & nurses to provide their patients with the best possible care.

To continue to shape the future of healthcare, we are looking for a (Senior) Full Stack Engineer as a key member of our development team. Your focus will be on implementing state-of-the-art software in a critical environment and working on large-scale infrastructure.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

 * Work directly with our core development team
 * Design, test, deploy and maintain Avelios services
 * Build large-scale software
 * Work on cutting-edge technology in medicine
 * Use best practices in fast and secure software engineering
 * Develop ideas to improve usability and performance

YOUR QUALIFICATIONS

 * Studies in Informatics, Computer Science or Business Informatics from a top university or equivalent practical experience
 * Experience in one or more: Java, C++, React, Typescript, Swift or Rust
 * Relevant coding experience (GitHub contributions beneficial)
 * Interest in learning new technologies
 * Solution-oriented mindset & focus on getting things done
 * Fluency in German or English

YOUR BENEFITS

 * A flexible as well as results-oriented working environment and trust-based working hours
 * A variety in your tasks and the opportunity to take ownership
 * An international, informal team structure in a motivating start-up atmosphere, allowing you to participate directly in our customer growth story and the overall success of Avelios
 * Ability to gain valuable hands-on experience in a startup backed by top European VCs
 * Attractive salary and virtual company shares
 * A monthly meal allowance up to 75 euros, the cost coverage of the Germany ticket (Deutschlandticket), and other additional benefits, such as UrbanSportsClub membership, a bike leasing program and corporate benefits

Apply for this job

ABOUT US

Working at Avelios means having a direct impact on improving our healthcare system and the quality of patient care. Our software is being used by doctors and nurses to treat patients in the best hospitals in Germany. We are growing fast and want to keep expanding our team and business to fundamentally digitize healthcare for the better. We appreciate different backgrounds and see diversity as one of our strengths.

Are you a talented, ambitious and impact-driven individual who wants to make a difference? Then what are you waiting for, apply now and join our team!

job_description:
INTRODUCTION SENTENCE

The ProSiebenSat.1 data organization consolidates the data of the group to make them available for the development of new Business Intelligence and Machine Learning products.
We at "AI Products" are an interdisciplinary and international team within the data organisation. Together we develop and operate IT applications for the entire ProSiebenSat.1 Group using artificial intelligence within a state-of-the-art technology stack. Our mission is to help our colleagues to get the most value from AI/Machine Learning initiatives by improving efficiency and effectiveness across all our business units.


WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT IN THIS ROLE

 * As Data Science & AI Intern you will learn the fundamentals required for a successful career as Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer
 * You will be joining one of our project teams focused on building machine learning products to solve real business challenges
 * You will develop productive machine learning applications on a petabyte sized data lake using practices such as Infrastructure as Code, Continuous Delivery, Test Driven Development, ETL Pipelines and Model Development and Deployment on our state-of-the-art AI/ML Cloud-Platform
 * You will improve your analytical skills through Data Analysis with SQL and Spark on distributed systems as well as through model selection and training using modern frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch etc.)
 * Teamwork and your personal development matter to us – you will be closely mentored by our experienced team and get extensive coaching
 * Depending on your performance you can join us as a permanent employee after your internship


YOUR ESSENTIAL EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION

 * You are in the final stages of your master studies in a technical or natural science related discipline or have just graduated
 * Ideally, you have already used your programming skills (Bash, Python or Java) in software development, and you have first experiences in cloud services (AWS, Azure or GCP) or Machine Learning
 * You enjoy familiarizing yourself with new topics, communicate proactively and are enthusiastic about new technologies
 * You have a very good command of English. Knowledge of German is considered a plus


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

 * Enjoy an open corporate culture without a dress code in the dynamic environment of the media industry
 * Depending on the tasks you take on in your team, there is the possibility of working on a mobile basis in coordination with your manager
 * Work at modern equipped workplaces and use our wide range of campus services including a canteen with fair prices, different coffee bars or our massage service
 * Benefit from a highly discounted, Germany-wide membership at Urban Sports Club as well as numerous other special discounts of our partners
 * We offer our interns and working students an extensive network so that you can meet new people outside of your field of expertise and gain insights into other areas at ProSiebenSat. 1.
 * You have the possibility to complete a voluntary internship as well as a compulsory internship within the scope of your university studies. Here you can find the general conditions


CLOSURE

We are looking forward to your application!

Apply within 5 minutes via our job portal or use the video application option.

Your profile doesn't fit 100%? No worries, apply anyway! We support your professional & personal development on the job.



You can find out more about our application process here .

Please note that we can not accept applications by mail due to data protection reasons.

ProSiebenSat.1 is more than television, much more. With a reach of 60 million TV households and 11 million people via our online channels, we are the leading German entertainment company and have a strong e-commerce and dating business.


COMPANY TEXT

Click here to learn more about the ProSiebenSat.1 Group located in Unterföhring near Munich and our diverse portfolio.

As a signatory of the Diversity Charter, ProSiebenSat.1 is committed to a working environment free of prejudice and actively promotes diversity and equal opportunities among employees.

You have a disability and would like to apply? Then you are very welcome.
We know that we are not entirely accessible yet, but we are working on it. Let's talk about how we can eliminate any barrier together and find an individual solution if needed.

Although we refer to one gender in the text, all genders may be implied.


 * Flexible Working Hours
 * No dress code
 * Intern and working student network
 * Special discounts with external partners
 * Hybrid Work
 * Urban Sports Club
 * Mobile Work in EU countries
 * Campus service and cafes

job_title: (Senior) Fullstack Software Engineer (Java/Kotlin/Python/JavaScript) (m/f/x) onsite or remote in Germany
job_description:
Company Description


Scalable Capital is a leading digital investment platform in Europe. The company empowers everyone to shape their financial future. Scalable Broker makes it easy and affordable for clients to invest professionally in stocks, ETFs and other exchange-traded products and set up savings plans. Scalable Wealth, the digital wealth management service, offers clients professional investment in ETF portfolios and is also adopted as a white-label solution by renowned B2B partners. With the European Investor Exchange (EIX) Scalable Capital offers a stock exchange for retail investors in Europe. Over 20 billion euro is held on the platform by more than one million clients.

Scalable Capital was founded in 2014 and employs more than 500 people at its offices in Munich, Berlin, Vienna, and London. Together with the founding and management team around Erik Podzuweit and Florian Prucker, they are working on a new generation of financial services.

Visit our finance blog or check out our Social Media channels to find out what our Expert Teams have to say.

Our Company Values guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. To learn more about them, you can find our values here (English).


Job Description


In Scalable’s growing Data Department, we are looking for developers for our new team “Data Integration & Management”. This team has a two-fold mission: On the one hand, the team is responsible for bringing data products (e.g. machine learning models) into production. Furthermore, providing software solutions allowing for smooth implementation of regulatory data-related requirements (as e.g. data protection required data deletions) in the Engineering Department belongs to the core competences. Thus, this team constitutes an essential bridge between data teams, other engineering teams and business as well as legal departments.

Key responsibilities:

 * Work as an engineer in an agile team of backend and fullstack engineers, with highly ambitious and skilled colleagues in our growing data department
 * Work closely together with data scientists and data engineers as well as other engineering teams
 * Bring data products to production and reveal real business value
 * Work on software solutions for ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements around data for the Engineering Department (as, e.g., automated data protection required data deletions)
 * Work with cutting edge technologies and be part of modern software development practices (e.g. agile teams, continuous integration and deployment, test automation, cloud-based infrastructure and tooling).
 * Write clean, testable, maintainable and well-documented code with high attention on security aspects


Qualifications

 * University degree in computer science, engineering, natural science, mathematics or similar field
 * Strong programming skills in Java/Kotlin – SpringBoot (BE) and Javascript, React, Node (FE), Python is a plus
 * Experience in developing code and building infrastructure on AWS
 * Experience in complex software projects with end-to-end ownership building Microservices
 * Interest in data projects and data-driven business applications
 * Experience with Google Tag Manager and Consent Management is a plus
 * Motivation to implement regulatory obligations arising, e.g., from data protection law
 * Good communication skills that are clear, open and concise, professional proficiency in English
 * Interest in FinTech industry
 * Positive outlook on life and sense of humour


Additional Information

 * Be part of one of the fastest-growing and most visible Fintech startups in Europe, creating innovative services that have a substantial impact on the lives of our customers
 * Work with an international, diverse, inclusive, and ever-growing team that loves creating the best products for our clients
 * Enjoy an office in a great location in the middle of Munich, Berlin, or choose to work remotely within Germany (if eligible for the job)
 * Be productive with the latest hardware and tools
 * Learn and grow by joining our in-house knowledge sharing sessions and spending your individual Education Budget

job.jobTitleText: (Senior) Fullstack Software Engineer (Java/Kotlin/Python/JavaScript) (m/f/x) onsite or remote in Germany

job_description:
S H Z Softwarehaus Zuleger GmbH ist ein erfahrener Dienstleister und ist seit über 20 Jahren erfolgreich tätig in den Bereichen Aerospace, Embedded Software, Technische Dokumentation, Systemanalysen und in der Entwicklung von Simulations- und Applikationssoftware.

Wir arbeiten mit interessanten Kunden aus den unterschiedlichsten Branchen zusammen. Exzellenz, Teamarbeit und individuelle Weiterentwicklung sind für uns der Schlüssel zum Erfolg.

Wir suchen ab sofort einen Systemingenieur (m/w/d)

Tätigkeiten:

 * Analyse und Erfassung von Projektanforderungen in Abstimmung mit dem Kunden
 * Definition und Planung von Entwicklungs- und Arbeitspaketen
 * Analyse, Ableitung und Definition von Kundenanforderungen
 * Definition einer aus den Analysen resultierenden Systemarchitektur und Beschreibung der Schnittstellen
 * Abgleich von produktspezifischen Anforderungen mit der existierenden Produktspezifikation
 * Erstellung der kundenspezifischen Spezifikationen
 * Durchführung eines toolunterstützten Anforderungsmanagements

Ihr Profil:

 * Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Fachrichtung Informatik oder vergleichbare Qualifikationen
 * Erfahrung im Bereich Requirement Engineering sowie technische Projektleitung (V-Modell, Agil)
 * Ausgeprägte Analysefähigkeit sowie Produktmanagementerfahrung
 * Selbständige Arbeitsweise, sehr gute team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit
 * Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
 * Erfahrung in Requirement-Engineering-Tools (Doors, Enterprise Architect) vorteilhaft
 * Kenntnisse im Bereich Softwaretechnologie (Modellierung und Test) und Simulationstechnik
 * Erfahrung mit virtueller Simulation
 * Erfahrung mit öffentlichen Auftraggebern vorteilhaft

Wir bieten Ihnen:

 * Persönliche Weiterentwicklung durch ein spannendes und vielseitiges Aufgabenspektrum und diverse Fort- und Weiterbildungsangebote
 * Gleitzeit, 30 Tage Urlaub im Jahr
 * Sicherheit in einem zukunftssicheren Beschäftigungsverhältnis mit unbefristetem Arbeitsvertrag, vermögenswirksamen Leistungen und einer betrieblichen Altersversorgung

Art der Stelle: Vollzeit, Festanstellung

Arbeitszeiten:

 * 8-Stunden-Schicht
 * Tagschicht

Leistungen:

 * Betriebliche Altersvorsorge

Sonderzahlung:

 * 13. Monatsgehalt
 * Urlaubsgeld
 * Weihnachtsgeld
 * Zusatzzahlungen

Arbeitsort: Zum Teil im Homeoffice in 80997 München

job_title: Lead Software Engineer Python C++ (d/m/w) to become Team...
job_description:
Benefits:

 * Take this chance to go from technical leadership to line management responsibility.
 * Be part of one of the most successful and highly scaling companies.
 * Work in a highly innovative IoT, Embedded, Hardware, Software, R&D field.
 * Use top-notch technology for real-time & sensor data processing, stream processing, image processing and edge computing.
 * Come to the inspiring office 3 days per week and feel free to work 2 from home.
 * Flexible working hours: There are some meetings but apart from this, work whenever is best for you.
 * Be part of fun after work events in Munich.
 * Go on workation with the team.
 * 30 days vacation and company closed December 24th and 31st.
 * Health insurance package.
 * Sports club membership.



Responsibilities:

 * You are the team lead of experienced IoT system and engineering experts.
 * You work 50% to guide the team regarding the system architecture, security standards, devops, troubleshooting and debugging.
 * You work 40% as the manager that sets the vision.
 * You work 10% hands-on and help the team with software development.
 * You transform IoT requirements into scalable, secure and efficient backend solutions.
 * Your department optimizes and automates consistently the software performance by spotting potential problems and solving them.
 * You work with technologies like Python, Linux Bash, GNU Make, GNU Compiler Collection, GNU Binutils, GNU Debugger, GNU Autotools, as well as Networking and Security Concepts.



Your profile:

 * You are a technical lead right now.
 * You are guiding your team right now in technical decisions regarding code development, system architecture, routing, firewalling, ideally with GNU tools, TCP, UDP, DNS, NAT.
 * You are fluent in Python, good in C++, and an expert in the design, implementation, migration, deployment, observability, monitoring of a production system.
 * You understand the concepts of distributed systems within IoT in depth.
 * You are able to work with Bash scripting and the Linux command line.
 * Minimum of 8 years experience as a Software and/or System Engineer.
 * Fluent in English.
 * Happy to come to the office in Munich 3 days a week.

job.jobTitleText: Lead Software Engineer Python C++ (d/m/w) to become Team...

job_title: Senior Full Stack Engineer - Vue.js, NestJS & TypeScript (m/f/d)
job_description:
INTRODUCTION:

As a Senior Full Stack Engineer (m/f/d) in our Product & Tech team, you have the opportunity to work on end-to-end product initiatives, overseeing all of our frontends and backends, and bringing value directly to our customers. If you're a passionate engineer with a hunger for continuous improvement and proficiency in a variety of programming languages, this is your chance to revolutionize the industry and make a direct impact on our dynamic, tech-driven team.

YOUR OBJECTIVES & ROLE:

 * Work on an amazing product with b2b and b2c aspects at the intersection of mobility and property technology
 * Implement features end-to-end as a Full Stack Engineer utilizing the latest front & backend technologies
 * Collaborate with our team consisting of (designers and back-end) programmers to ensure that our UI is as simple and effective as possible
 * Work together with our dev-ops & ML-engineers in implementing new features and optimize processes
 * Proactively identify how our product can be further developed and improve the frontend in close cooperation with our UX designers
 * Shape our engineering culture by employing modern software engineering practices, focusing on writing clean, well-tested, and efficient code
 * Continuously deploy code into production

YOUR EXPERTISE, SKILLS & MINDSET:

 * Real seniority. Not defined by years of experience but by strive for continuous improvement, direct impact on the business, and ownership
 * Be a pro in more than one field (TypeScript, Vue.js, NestJS, CSS/HTML and more)
 * Strong experience in real production projects with high throughput
 * Excellent written and spoken English skills (level C1). German language proficiency is not required

TECHNOLOGIES WE WORK WITH:

 * Frontend monorepo with Turbo, pnpm, changesets, and storybook, primarily using Vue.js
 * Event-driven backend development in Python and NestJS, following a microservice architecture
 * Adoption of TypeScript, NestJS, BullMQ, and Prisma for backends in an opinionated monorepo approach
 * Amazon RDS, DynamoDB, S3
 * Container orchestration with Kubernetes and CI/CD using GitLab
 * Infrastructure provisioning on AWS using Terraform
 * Leveraging the serverless framework on AWS Lambda for high-throughput endpoints

WHAT WE OFFER:

 * MacBook or ThinkPad and a 37-inch curved screen for your work setup
 * Startup atmosphere with flat hierarchies and agile team structures
 * Flexible working hours and the option to work from home or our state-of-the-art office in Munich, equipped with standing desks
 * Competitive salary
 * Company pension plan
 * Daily meal allowance, free team lunch once a week, cereal bar, and free drinks
 * Job bike and access to sports and fitness facilities through EGYM Wellpass or Urban Sports Club membership across Germany
 * Professional development opportunities
 * German language course
 * Discounts on various branded products through our partner Corporate Benefits

OUR RECRUITING PROCESS:

1. Initial contact with 48h
2. Interview with you and a member of our team
3. Coding Challenge
4. In person meeting in Munich

Send your application, including all relevant documents, to recruiting@peter-park.de. We look forward to hearing from you!

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: 70.000,00€ - 80.000,00€ per year

Ability to commute/relocate:

 * 81541 München: Reliably commute or willing to relocate with an employer-provided relocation package (Preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 81541 München

  • Collaborate with our team consisting of (designers and back-end) programmers to ensure that our UI is as simple and effective as possible
  • Work together with our dev-ops & ML-engineers in implementing new features and optimize processes
  • Proactively identify how our product can be further developed and improve the frontend in close cooperation with our UX designers
  • Shape our engineering culture by employing modern software engineering practices, focusing on writing clean, well-tested, and efficient code
  • Continuously deploy code into production

YOUR EXPERTISE, SKILLS & MINDSET:

  • Real seniority. Not defined by years of experience but by strive for continuous improvement, direct impact on the business, and ownership
  • Be a pro in more than one field (TypeScript, Vue.js, NestJS, CSS/HTML and more)
  • Strong experience in real production projects with high throughput
  • Excellent written and spoken English skills (level C1). German language proficiency is not required

TECHNOLOGIES WE WORK WITH:

  • Frontend monorepo with Turbo, pnpm, changesets, and storybook, primarily using Vue.js
  • Event-driven backend development in Python and NestJS, following a microservice architecture
  • Adoption of TypeScript, NestJS, BullMQ, and Prisma for backends in an opinionated monorepo approach
  • Amazon RDS, DynamoDB, S3
  • Container orchestration with Kubernetes and CI/CD using GitLab
  • Infrastructure provisioning on AWS using Terraform
  • Leveraging the serverless framework on AWS Lambda for high-throughput endpoints

WHAT WE OFFER:

  • MacBook or ThinkPad and a 37-inch curved screen for your work setup
  • Startup atmosphere with flat hierarchies and agile team structures
  • Flexible working hours and the option to work from home or our state-of-the-art office in Munich, equipped with standing desks
  • Competitive salary
  • Company pension plan
  • Daily meal allowance, free team lunch once a week, cereal bar, and free drinks
  • Job bike and access to sports and fitness facilities through EGYM Wellpass or Urban Sports Club membership across Germany
  • Professional development opportunities
  • German language course
  • Discounts on various branded products through our partner Corporate Benefits

OUR RECRUITING PROCESS:

1. Initial contact with 48h
2. Interview with you and a member of our team
3. Coding Challenge
4. In person meeting in Munich

Send your application, including all relevant documents, to recruiting@peter-park.de. We look forward to hearing from you!

job_title: Intern Embedded AI & Ml Engineer for Intelligent Interactive Systems (f/m/x)
job_description:
SOME IT WORKS. SOME CHANGES WHAT'S POSSIBLE.

SHARE YOUR PASSION.

More than 90% of automotive innovations are based on electronics and software. That's why creative freedom and lateral thinking are so important in the pursuit of truly novel solutions. That’s why our experts will treat you as part of the team from day one, encourage you to bring your own ideas to the table – and give you the opportunity to really show what you can do.

We, the BMW Group, offer you an interesting and varied internship in the area of Embedded AI System, Machine Learning and Robotics, in the context of Intelligent Human-Machine/Vehicle Interaction and Collaboration.




What awaits you?

 * Contributing to the deveopment of next generation of the intelligent interactive vehicle.
 * Integrating and deployment mulit-modal sensory information and perception (digital signal processing, pattern recognition, embedded systems architectures, communications) for human-vehicle interaction.
 * Collaborating with an highly specialised international team of AI/ ML and robotics scientists and engineers.
 * Contribute to applied research and pre-development projects within BMW.
 * The work will be carried out at BMW AI Lab & the RoboTac team, Technology Group of BMW Center of Invention, Munich, Germany.


What should you bring along?

 * University degree in electrical /electronic / control engineering, computer science or a comparable course of study or a comparable qualification.
 * In-depth knowledge of digital signal processing, embedded system, hardware propgramming & architecture, pattern recognition, ML pipeline with very good analytical thinking and error analysis skills required.
 * Extensive practical embedded harware systems & ML software development preferably in C/C++ & Python required.
 * Knowledge of microcontrollers and in scripting languages (e.g. Python, C++) would be required.
 * Experience in developing and integrating software platforms for embedded devices would be required.




What do we offer?

 * Comprehensive mentoring & onboarding.
 * Personal & professional development.
 * Flexible working hours.
 * Digital offers & mobile working.
 * Attractive remuneration.
 * Apartment offers for students (subject to availability & only Munich).
 * And many other benefits - see bmw.jobs/benefits




You enjoy working in an international team? Apply now!




At the BMW Group, we see diversity and inclusion in all its dimensions as a strength for our teams. Equal opportunities are a particular concern for us, and the equal treatment of applicants and employees is a fundamental principle of our corporate policy. That is why our recruiting decisions are also based on personality, experience and skills.

Find out more about diversity at the BMW Group at bmwgroup.jobs/diversity


Earliest starting date: from 08/12/2024

Duration: 6 months

Working hours: Full-time


Contact:
BMW Group HR Team
+49 89 382-17001

job_description:
Locations: Munich, Germany / Amersfoort, the Netherlands

Workin time: Full-time, Hybrid

We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Senior Software Compiler Engineer to join our team at TASKING. Positions are open in both Germany (Munich area) and the Netherlands.

Who are we?

TASKING is a leading provider of development tools headquartered in Munich, Germany, offering high-performance, high-quality, safety & security-oriented embedded software development tools for multi-core architectures. Our development tools are used by automotive manufacturers and suppliers, as well as in adjacent markets around the world to realize high-performance applications in safety-critical areas.

As the recognized leader in high-quality, feature- and safety-compliant embedded software development tools, TASKING enables you to create code with best-in-class size and performance with compilers, debuggers and RTOS support for industry-leading microprocessors and microcontrollers.

Our customers are served from sales offices in the EU, US, China, Japan, Korea and India. Product development facilities are located in Munich (DE), Amersfoort (NL) and Ljubljana (SI).

Join us at TASKING and contribute to the success of our customers and the growth of our company!




Responsibilities:

 * Requirements analysis, requirements specification and test specification
 * Design, implement, document, test, and debug new and existing software units
 * Negotiating and influencing technical issues and solutions within the project team
 * Design and build ready-to-use example projects and reference designs
 * Benchmarking and Performance improvements
 * Bi-directional exchange with support engineers
 * Negotiating and influencing technical issues and solutions within the project team and product management
 * Change Analysis and Effort Estimation




Qualifications:

 * A degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field
 * Familiar with multiple programming languages and have excellent C/C++ programming skills and proficiency in using scripting languages
 * Has contributed to either proprietary or open-source compiler code bases or has developed static analysis tools
 * Is capable of solving complex problems where solutions can have wide-ranging effect on the TASKING product or product development.
 * A Senior Software Engineer has at least five years experience as Software Engineer.




What do we offer:

 * Flexible working environment in an open-minded organization with a professionally challenging and informal working environment
 * Continuing professional growth and the opportunity to build a career within our international organization
 * An attractive benefits package incl. medical insurance, allowances, and wellness pass
 * Competitive compensation aligned with industry benchmarks




Ready to put your skills to work?

Then we'd love to hear from you! Please submit your application directly through LinkedIn or send an email to recruitment@tasking.com




TASKING complies with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and any other data protection laws or regulations that apply to TASKING. The company’s data privacy policy is also available on the company’s website: https://www.tasking.com/privacy-policy

job_title: Senior Software Engineer for Display Functions - ADAS/AD (m/f/d)
job_description:
Senior Software Engineer for Display Functions - ADAS/AD (m/f/d)

Software Engineering

Professional


Munich, Ingolstadt, Wolfsburg, Nuremberg, Mönsheim/Stuttgart, Berlin




At CARIAD, we're bundling and further expanding the Volkswagen Group's software expertise. We’re uniting over 6,500 global experts to build a scalable technology stack, including a software platform, unified electronic architecture and reliable connection to the automotive cloud. Our CARIDIANS are developing vehicle functions such as driver assistance systems, a next-generation infotainment platform, power electronics and charging technology, and digital services in and around the vehicle.

Our software can already be found in Volkswagen ID. models and will soon power Audi and Porsche vehicles with the E3 1.2 platform in 2024.

It's no easy task, but with experts like you, we can shape the future of mobility. Join us at CARIAD and be part of this exciting journey!



YOUR TEAM

Our department is responsible for the development of HMI solutions for ADAS products within the Volkswagen Group. Our focus lies on the development of features and technologies which directly impact how the driver percieves and interacts with the vehicle. We are working in an agile way through the whole event chain in close coordination with departments from Audi, CARIAD, Porsche and VW to offer the best and most innovative solutions for the customers of our cars. Most importantly this department is a young, divers, interdisciplinary, and highly motivated team looking forward to your application!


WHAT YOU WILL DO



 * Implement and sustain software units for ADAS-related components, ensuring high performance and reliability.
 * Write and maintain comprehensive unit tests to validate software functionality, ensuring quality and robustness.
 * Map requirements from the system and architecture levels down to the code, ensuring full compliance and traceability.
 * Define and maintain the software architecture, ensuring scalability, maintainability, and integration with other systems.
 * Work within an agile team, contributing to iterative development cycles and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
 * Support the setup and enhancement of software infrastructure, enabling efficient development and deployment processes.
 * Assist in establishing and refining test environments, ensuring accurate and efficient validation of software components.




WHO YOU ARE



 * Academic background in Computer Science, Information Technology, Robotics, or related field
 * Extensive experience in Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) with a strong understanding of ADAS system development processes.
 * Exceptional programming skills, particularly in C++ and Python, with hands-on experience in developing real-time software systems and familiarity with ASPICE processes.
 * Basic knowledge of HIS/MISRA/Autosar guidelines, with demonstrated ability to write, optimize, and troubleshoot code for Electronic Control Units (ECUs) is highly advantageous.
 * Fluency in English is required; proficiency in German is a plus and highly desirable.




NICE TO KNOW



 * Remote work options
 * Temporary work from abroad in selected countries
 * Flextime / optional working hours
 * Company pension plan
 * Annual professional development
 * Sabbatical option up to 6 months
 * 30 days paid + 10 days unpaid leave
 * Possibility for VW Group car leasing
 * If you have further questions about the candidate journey at CARIAD, please contact us: careers@cariad.technology




YOUR RECRUITING CONTACT

Kyra Alas Lojewski

At CARIAD, we value individuality and diversity. We see great strength in our differences and can all benefit from the unique perspectives of others. We strive to employ people with diverse backgrounds who have the expertise, energy and focus to advance our mission. If you're unable to submit an application because of a disability, please contact us at careers@cariad.technology.




Share this job

header.jobTitleText: Senior Software Engineer for Display Functions - ADAS/AD (m/f/d)

job.description:
Senior Software Engineer for Display Functions - ADAS/AD (m/f/d)

Software Engineering

Professional

Munich, Ingolstadt, Wolfsburg, Nuremberg, Mönsheim/Stuttgart, Berlin

At CARIAD, we're bundling and further expanding the Volkswagen Group's software expertise. We’re uniting over 6,500 global experts to build a scalable technology stack, including a software platform, unified electronic architecture and reliable connection to the automotive cloud. Our CARIDIANS are developing vehicle functions such as driver assistance systems, a next-generation infotainment platform, power electronics and charging technology, and digital services in and around the vehicle.

Our software can already be found in Volkswagen ID. models and will soon power Audi and Porsche vehicles with the E3 1.2 platform in 2024.

It's no easy task, but with experts like you, we can shape the future of mobility. Join us at CARIAD and be part of this exciting journey!


YOUR TEAM

Our department is responsible for the development of HMI solutions for ADAS products within the Volkswagen Group. Our focus lies on the development of features and technologies which directly impact how the driver percieves and interacts with the vehicle. We are working in an agile way through the whole event chain in close coordination with departments from Audi, CARIAD, Porsche and VW to offer the best and most innovative solutions for the customers of our cars. Most importantly this department is a young, divers, interdisciplinary, and highly motivated team looking forward to your application!

WHAT YOU WILL DO

  • Implement and sustain software units for ADAS-related components, ensuring high performance and reliability.
  • Write and maintain comprehensive unit tests to validate software functionality, ensuring quality and robustness.
  • Map requirements from the system and architecture levels down to the code, ensuring full compliance and traceability.
  • Define and maintain the software architecture, ensuring scalability, maintainability, and integration with other systems.
  • Work within an agile team, contributing to iterative development cycles and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
  • Support the setup and enhancement of software infrastructure, enabling efficient development and deployment processes.
  • Assist in establishing and refining test environments, ensuring accurate and efficient validation of software components.

WHO YOU ARE

  • Academic background in Computer Science, Information Technology, Robotics, or related field
  • Extensive experience in Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) with a strong understanding of ADAS system development processes.
  • Exceptional programming skills, particularly in C++ and Python, with hands-on experience in developing real-time software systems and familiarity with ASPICE processes.
  • Basic knowledge of HIS/MISRA/Autosar guidelines, with demonstrated ability to write, optimize, and troubleshoot code for Electronic Control Units (ECUs) is highly advantageous.
  • Fluency in English is required; proficiency in German is a plus and highly desirable.

NICE TO KNOW
